Class Board

java.lang.Object
board.Board
public class Board extends Object
Represents the chessboard as an 8x8 array of Pieces. Manages the game state, piece placement, and move validation.

  • Constructor Summary

    Constructors
    Constructor
    Description
    Board()
    Constructs a new chess board and initializes it with pieces in starting positions.

    • Board

      public Board()
      Constructs a new chess board and initializes it with pieces in starting positions.

  • Method Details

    • initializeBoard

      public void initializeBoard()
      Initializes the board with pieces in their starting positions.

    • display

      public void display()
      Displays the current board state in the console.

    • getPiece

      public Piece getPiece(int row, int col)
      Gets the piece at the specified board position.
      Parameters:
      row - The row of the piece (0-7).
      col - The column of the piece (0-7).
      Returns:
      The piece at the given position, or null if empty.
      Throws:
      IndexOutOfBoundsException - if the position is invalid.

    • getBoard

      public Piece[][] getBoard()
      Gets the current board state as a 2D array. Used by Player class to update available pieces.
      Returns:
      The 2D array representing the board.

    • movePiece

      public boolean movePiece(int fromRow, int fromCol, int toRow, int toCol)
      Moves a piece from one position to another if the move is valid.
      Parameters:
      fromRow - The starting row of the piece.
      fromCol - The starting column of the piece.
      toRow - The destination row.
      toCol - The destination column.
      Returns:
      true if the move was successful, false otherwise.

    • notationToCoords

      public static int[] notationToCoords(String notation)
      Converts chess notation (e.g., "e4") to board coordinates.
      Parameters:
      notation - The chess notation string (e.g., "e4", "A1").
      Returns:
      An array containing [row, col] coordinates, or null if invalid.

    • coordsToNotation

      public static String coordsToNotation(int row, int col)
      Converts board coordinates to chess notation.
      Parameters:
      row - The row (0-7).
      col - The column (0-7).
      Returns:
      The chess notation string (e.g., "e4"), or null if invalid.

    • getCurrentPlayer

      public String getCurrentPlayer()
      Gets the current player whose turn it is.
      Returns:
      The current player ("white" or "black").

    • setCurrentPlayer

      public void setCurrentPlayer(String player)
      Sets the current player (used for testing or special scenarios).
      Parameters:
      player - The player to set as current ("white" or "black").

    • reset

      public void reset()
      Resets the board to the initial game state.

    • isValidPosition

      public boolean isValidPosition(int row, int col)
      Checks if the specified position is within the board bounds.
      Parameters:
      row - The row to check.
      col - The column to check.
      Returns:
      true if the position is valid, false otherwise.

    • isEmpty

      public boolean isEmpty(int row, int col)
      Checks if a square is empty.
      Parameters:
      row - The row to check.
      col - The column to check.
      Returns:
      true if the square is empty, false otherwise.

    • getPieceCount

      public int getPieceCount()
      Gets the total number of pieces on the board.
      Returns:
      The count of pieces currently on the board.

    • getPieceCount

      public int getPieceCount(String color)
      Gets the number of pieces for a specific color.
      Parameters:
      color - The color to count ("white" or "black").
      Returns:
      The count of pieces for the specified color.
